alert.note: Alert for Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 5:35PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL TEHAMA AND SOUTH CENTRAL SHASTA COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM PDT... At 534 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Dairyville, or 13 miles northeast of Red Bluff, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Red Bluff, Anderson, Dairyville, Blossom, Paynes Creek, Manton, and Cottonwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley
